title.narrative: Food literacy education promoting gender equality and the empowerment of girls and poor women in Cameroon

description.narrative: The project is continuation of a partnership project between l'Association des conseillers en economie sociale et familiale du Cameroun (Cameroon association of home economics counsellors) (ACESF-CA) and the Finnish home economics association Martat which began in 2012 The project is justified by the fact that in Cameroon 37.5% of the population that is 8.1 million people live below the poverty threshold set at 931 CFAF (141 ?) per day for each equivalent adult. Women are the most affected by this poverty a nd living conditions of their families. On the other hand the current life and future of the young girl (woman of tomorrow) are influenced by sexist discriminations which result from poor sociocultural practices. Often underprivileged women have very thin knowledge on nutrition and the nutritive value of local foods. Hence they can?t improve their healthThe overall objective of the project is to contribute to an increased empowerment of poor women and girls in families and the Cameroon society.The project i s composed of four strategic axes: 1. Nutrition education2. Improving the income of beneficiaries3. Promoting gender equality and the empowerment of girls of the Home Economics field4. Institutional capacity building for ACESF-CAThe direct beneficiaries sh all comprise: 540 poor women who will take part in the training sessions on nutrition, 210 underprivileged women who will be accompanied in the drafting and execution of their business plans, 900 girls of the Home Economics field grouped under 12 ACESF-CA/ SU clubs will participate in activities held on several topics, 12 regional animators and 60 volunteer members chosen from Home Economics professionals who are members of ACESF-CA who will take refresher courses in pedagogy on nutrition and entrepreneurshi p.The intervention zone of the project will comprise six regions: Bafoussam Bamenda Bertoua Douala Maroua and Yaounde.The main partners of the project are the Martat association and ACESF-CA. The latter will work in collaboration with the external services of the Ministry of Women Empowerment and the Family (MINPROFF) and the Ministry of Secondary Education (MINESEC).
